DOC.brief_summary: Diabetes mellitus disease great frequency major public health problem . In Lebanon , incidence diabetes estimate 12 % , expect double year 2025 . Given increase prevalence diabetes Lebanon , evolution complication disease lack study level , appropriate conduct study aim evaluate effect education program people type 2 diabetes sense self-efficacy ability self-manage disease make optimal therapeutic adherence possible . The design study experimental type / randomization diabetic patient . Education program deliver experimental group `` Accu-Chek Education Program '' Roche . Membership assess use biomarker HbA1c < 7 % , questionnaire ( Summary Diabetes Self-Care Activities Measure ) , measure self-care behavior . Self-efficacy measure use Diabetes Management Self-Efficacy Scale . And intervention 3 month later . The sample 240 diabetic patient T2 . Recruitment outpatient diabetology Hospital locate Beirut . Statistical analyze use descriptive variable measure central tendency , dispersion frequency distribution . T-test chi-square use compare socio-demographic characteristic 2 group , experimental control . To test hypothesis determine difference result dependent variable 2 group , analysis variance covariance use . The data process use SPSS version 14.0 .
DOC.brief_title: Effects Education Program Lebanese Diabetic T2 Their Behavior Auto Managing , Self-efficacy Adhesion
DOC.detailed_description: 1 . Following implementation program education , feel self-efficacy participant higher experimental group control group . 2 . Following implementation program education , self-management behavior : monitoring diet , practice physical exercise , self-monitoring blood sugar , take medication care foot , participant higher experimental group control group . 3 . Following implementation program education , percentage participant HbA1c le 7 high experimental group control group .
DOC.criteria: 18 year , Suffering type 2 diabetes least one year , Lebanese speak , read write Arabic , Have HbA1c â‰¥ 7 % mental impairment psychological problem uncontrolled medicate
